<L>22015.50<pc>126,2<k1>ā<k2>ā́<e>1A	¦ (as a conjunctive particle) moreover, further, and (it is placed either between the two words connected [rarely after the second, <ls>RV. x, 16, 11</ls>, or after both, <ls>RV. x, 92, 8</ls>] or, if there are more, after the last [<ls>RV. iv, 57, 1 and x, 75, 5</ls>]; See also <s>ā<srs/>taś ca</s> <ab>s.v.</ab>) In classical <ns>Sanskṛt</ns> it may denote the limit ‘to’, ‘until’, ‘as far as’, ‘from’, either not including the object named or including it (sometimes with <ab>acc.</ab> or <ab>abl.</ab> or forming an <ab>adv.</ab>) <ab>e.g.</ab> <s>ā-maraṇam</s> or <s>ā-maraṇāt</s>, ‘till death’ <ls>Pañcat.</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> <s>ā-maraṇā<srs/>nta</s> &c.)	<LEND>
